before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"7qc6s","text":"Check to make sure you have all the starting materials available and assembled to prepare the reagent stocks.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"325i1","text":"The process of gel electrophoresis involves separating DNA fragments using an electrical current while tracking the rate of molecular movement through a filtering gel.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b1bl3","text":"Adding blue or orange tracking dye to colourless DNA samples allows you to see your sample and obtain information about how DNA molecules move during electrophoresis. Identification is based on the size of DNA bands on the gel after migration of molecules.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2qs1v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bk0kd","text":"The Beneficial Bio 6x loading dye is composed of bromophenol blue and xylene cyanol. Thus, it helps you determine the rate of movement of different size DNA molecules in the gel during electrophoresis. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4csib","text":"When composing or preparing DNA loading dyes, a heavy, syrupy substance that gives more density to the DNA sample before it is inserted in the wells is needed. This will help the DNA sample sink forming a layer in the well instead of being dispersed in the absence of a  heavy substance. In this formulation, trehalose is used to give the DNA samples the desired viscosity. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"387p6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: preparing 6x DNA loading dye, preparing DNA tracking dye

Trehalose).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":132,"length":72}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":28,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":62,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":66,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":145,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":187,"length":1},{"key":5,"offset":192,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3f649","text":"Cork the tube firmly and mix by inverting the tube several times.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8o9bk","text":"Store the working solution at room temperature or  for up to {"blocks":[{"key":"75aq4","text":"The Quality control tests performed for the DNA loading dye include:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4t2au","text":"Functionality test","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a3j4d","text":"Nuclease test","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5o90o","text":"The protocols can be found here.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":31,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":27,"length":4}],"data":{}},{"key":"4q0fo","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dtiu8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"0AF90780F22F11ECA1F7EB810CD1C20C","url":"https://www.protocols.io/edit/beneficial-bio-products-quality-control-tests-cbfssjne"}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6aml8","text":"We adopted these tests to confirm the integrity and quality of our DNA loading dye formulation but the quality control tests that could be performed are not limited to these two. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d9lhg","text":"If the DNA loading dye is not used on the spot or is to be sent outside the facility, it is packaged under aseptic conditions to reduce or control contamination that may affect its functionality following the steps in this protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":218,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":218,"length":13}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"557553E0F22F11ECA1F7EB810CD1C20C","url":"https://www.protocols.io/edit/beneficial-bio-products-packaging-protocol-cbfjsjkn"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9d71j","text":"During packaging, a user manual or datasheets are included to help the user effectively use the product. Before using the DNA loading dye, read and follow the instructions described in the user protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":189,"length":13}],"data":{}},{"key":"e9act","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ai82","text":"If any difficulty or abnormalities are encountered during production or using, refer to the trouble shooting section of the user protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":92,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":92,"length":16}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"43A561D0F3A811ECA4EAF13F43C5C65A","url":"https://www.protocols.io/edit/concentrated-dna-loading-dye-stock-user-protocol-cbtvsnn6"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"7A99AE30F3A811ECA4EAF13F43C5C65A","url":"https://www.protocols.io/private/B8A5C854F23B11ECA31A0A58A9FEAC02?step=2"}}}}
